name: Delhi Daredevils v Royal Challengers Bangalore

commentary.text: Bangalore jog out into the field, their captain carrying the ball in his hands. Behind them come Delhi's openers M Vijay and Mayank Agarwal. Mitchell Starc is revving up, with the crowd chanting with the countdown clock

$$6.20$$ $$pm$$  We're about 10 minutes away from the start of the match. Aside from the surprising exclusion, Bangalore have also gone for two promising Indian talents in Yuzvendra Chahal and Sachin Rana
avi: "I am sure R Sharma must be most relieved person after hearing that Gayle is not playing"
Sumeet Vaidya: "Elected to chase. Well, what do you expect if Kohli is captain :)"

Venkat Sravanth: "Is Bangalore trying to set an even playing field for Delhi by compensating KP's loss with the dropping of Gayle? Or do they seriously believe that Gayle's not good enough to be in the XI??" It might be something relating to his fitness. Remember he has a pretty dodgy knee

$$Bangalore$$ $$have$$ $$won$$ $$the$$ $$toss$$ $$and$$ $$elect$$ $$to$$ $$bowl$$ . Nic Maddinson, Mitchell Starc, AB de Villiers and Albie Morkel are the overseas players.  $$No$$ $$Chris$$ $$Gayle$$ $$then$$ , at least from what Virat Kohli said at the toss. The pitch is good and hard, he adds and would be good for the batsmen and he preferred to restrict Delhi and then chase them down.
Dinesh Karthik who is leading Delhi says Ross Taylor, Jimmy Neesham, Wayne Parnell and JP Duminy are his overseas players and praised the balance of the side.

$$5.55$$ $$pm$$  Oh, just in case you've not got it down, Dan Vettori still a practicing cricketer in the international arena has swapped his playing jersy for the coach's hat this season. Parthiv Patel calls him "chilled out" which really isn't breaking news, is it?

Madhushekar : "I am a Bangalorean how can I support them when they dont have a single player from karnataka. The domestic irani and one day champs. So much for this tournament fostering franchise loyalty. Enjoyed domestic season more"
James: "Any side that can include Gayle, Kohli, AB and Yuvraj in its top and middle order must be in with a chance. The 2 best (on current form) limited overs batsmen in the world. Plus Chris Gayle."

Umm Abeeha: "Delhi's best chance is to ask Bangalore to bat, try to restrict them to under 150 (hope Duminy bowls to Gayle opening over)and then look to chase it with Duminy, Taylor, De Kock and Indian support cast of Karthik, Tiwary and M Vijay.."

$$5.30$$ $$pm$$  We're into the second day and this time the action shifts to Sharjah where Delhi and Bangalore begin to bury the disappointments of the previous season. In apology for such an unimaginative introduction let me plug in Abhishek Purohit's  $$preview$$ as quickly as possible

Jose: "Yesterday, three who are keen to get an entry/re-entry into the India team failed -- Gauti, Yusuf, & Uthappa. Today, another one has to try to prevent a possible exit -- Yuvi. Wish him all the success. For his sake, and for his good friend Kohli's sake. Between the two teams, Bangalore looks stronger in batting (especially with KP not playing for Delhi), and Delhi looks better in bowling. T-20, being a mirage, what looks right need not be, by the time you crawl up to the mirage!"

$$CricIQ$$  got off to a blistering start yesterday with, with Philckt topping the daily leaderboard with 3317 points and taking home huge prizes. We are into Day 2 of the season now, and it's another chance to stake your claim at The Greatest Test Ever, and book a seat at Lord's for the India v England Test this summer.  $$Play$$ $$here.$$
Starc to Agarwal,no run,crisply punched into the covers as he leans forward to the fuller delivery angled across him
Starc to Agarwal,1 wide,teases the batsman outside off again but he goes a bit too far there
Starc to Agarwal,2 runs,slices it to deep third man who slaps the ball back into the field of play. Full and slated wide again. Had to reach for it
Starc to Agarwal,no run,strides forward and drills another solid drive into the covers
Starc to Agarwal,1 run,walks at the bowler as Starc manages a bit of inward dip. Agarwal uses it and flicks through midwicket
Starc to Vijay,no run,dug in short on middle, defended
Starc to Vijay,no run,some late inward movement again but Vijay negotiates it well with a front foot defensive
Albie Morkel from the other end
Morkel to Agarwal,1 run,starts off short and it's pulled to deep midwicket. Seemed a little cramped there which limited his timing a bit
Vishnu Mohan: "Seriously, how come Mayank is preferred than Sourabh Tiwary or Kedhar Jadhav?? #stunned" Cause the other two don't open
Morkel to Vijay,no run,fullish and outside off and Morkel even gets a bit of nibble away. Vijay leaves it watchfully
Morkel to Vijay,1 run,back of a length and angled in at him, clipped off his thighs to deep square leg

Morkel to Agarwal,no run,poor shot selection there. Keeps it back of a length and refuses him any room to free those arms. Agarwal is on the front foot and goes for a flat-batted pull. Hits high on the bat and drops just short of mid-on
Morkel to Agarwal,1 run,shortish and outside off, dabbed behind point for a quick single
Morkel to Vijay,no run,fullish and just outside off, strides forward and defends to point. Yuvraj sends in a throw at the non-strikers'
Starc to Agarwal,1 run,145kph, that's his main threat and he almost had his man. Fullish and curling in rather late. Agarwal had to adjust his shot and block and gets more of an inside edge

Starc to Vijay, $$SIX$$ ,picked away, that's a Vijay special! It was full and on the pads, a very strong area for the opener. Ensured his front foot was not in the way and an effortless whip of the wrists sends the ball beyond the square leg boundary
Starc to Vijay,no run,pulls his length back a bit and directs the ball wider of off stump, Vijay prefers not to play
Starc to Vijay,1 run,nicely bowled, but Vijay negotiates the inswing well. Clips into the midwicker region for a single
Starc to Agarwal,no run,shortish and angled across him, Agarwal made room outside leg and looks to carve it over point. Beaten

Starc to Agarwal, $$OUT$$ ,he seemed a little too generous with that pull shot despite being late on it once before. Starc digs it in and it comes in at an awkward bounce, there is also a bit too much pace on the ball and he splices it to square leg
Morkel to Vijay,no run,back of a length on off stump, Vijay covers the line and blocks it
Morkel to Vijay,1 run,too straight and Vijay is comfortable clipping it away to deep square leg
Dinesh Karthik, the captain, takes guard

Morkel to Karthik, $$OUT$$ ,golden duck for the captain! What a ripper from Albie! Gets one to straighten and extracts a bit more bounce as well. All that combine to claim a faint edge as Karthik prodded forward and the keeper did the rest

Arjun: "You know.. the crowd support in UAE got me thinking.. What if every Indian T20 started off with 1-2 weeks in a different off-beat location where cricket can be promoted? For locations that are further away from India, there could be a few days break in between. That way.. we can ensure franchises build teams for all conditions too."
Morkel to Tiwary,no run,back of a length and outside off, left alone
Morkel to Tiwary,1 run,skips down the track as Albie fires at his pads, Tiwary the new batsman, gets an inside edge that wanders into the leg side
Morkel to Vijay,no run,more shape away and Vijay was left groping at it. No foot movement as he hung his bat and the good length ball darts across the outside edge
Sam Richards: "yesterday gambhir went for a duck and Kolkata won, so now will Delhi will win today" Bowling change, Varun Aaron

Aaron to Tiwary, $$OUT$$ ,what a soft dismissal, caught down the leg side! Kohli high-fives his bowler and Bangalore are jubilant. Tiwary shuffled across to try and glance it fine but the ball, just short of a good length, runs off the face and Parthiv collects another simple catch
JP Duminy has a slip, Aaron around the stumps
Aaron to Duminy,no run,back of a length and outside off, JP shoulders arms
Aaron to Duminy,no run,nice little stroke. Covered his stumps and angled the shortish ball outside off to point. Very compact
Aaron to Duminy,no run,short of a length and outside off, Duminy looks to run it down the third man but doesn't get the requisite amount of bat on it
Aaron to Duminy,no run,good length and angled in at middle. Turned away to square leg
Tariq: "So much for all the hype about reformed Delhi team……looks like same old team with no changes in performance."
Aaron to Duminy,no run,that's a  $$wicket-maiden$$ . Aaron digs this is short and gets it to rise around chest-high. Duminy dead bats it into the leg side.

Morkel to Vijay, $$FOUR$$ ,short fine leg makes a mess of it. He had to move to his left a bit but the ball sneaks under his dive. Albie is not pleased as Vijay's flick gets four more than it deserved
Morkel to Vijay,2 runs,good length ball on off stump, Vijay comes forward and blocks to mid-on. A ricochet off the stumps at the bowler's end fetches an overthrow
Morkel to Vijay,1 run,goes slower, think it was the offcutter. Vijay is wise to it and drops it into the off side for a quick single

Viral Bhatt: "Towards the start of this match, few would have expected this out of Bangalore's bowling attack and look what these 3 pacers have done. They've simply annihilated Delhi's back-bone. If they are able to keep the same momentum for rest of the season, Bangalore will be the team to beat, especially when they already have such a formidable batting order. Loads of work needs to be done by Duminy and Taylor in this match though."
Morkel to Duminy, $$FOUR$$ ,gorgeous shot! Didn't do much more than present a full face to the overpitched delivery but he had just timed it so well
$$Allan$$ $$Donald$$ $$the$$ $$bowling$$ $$coach$$ $$for$$ $$Bangalore$$ $$says$$ $$Chris$$ $$Gayle$$ $$has$$ $$a$$ $$bit$$ $$of$$ $$a$$ $$back$$ $$issue$$
Morkel to Duminy,1 run,corrects slides it off the open face to deep third man for a single
Morkel to Vijay,1 run,fullish and angling in at him, Vijay is forward and flicks away to deep midwikcet
kailesh: "@tariq .... its just the first match ... you got to have some patience .. its a new look team and hence it will gain momentum gradually as the tournament progresses .. "
Aaron to Vijay,no run,shortish on middle and off, Vijay stands up tall and blocks
Aaron to Vijay,no run,lazy waft outside off and he's beaten again. Aaron goes fishing outside off stump and gets a bit of away swing to bolster his case, but the edge is not forthcoming
Aaron to Vijay,no run,145kph, that's some excellent aggression from the quick bowler. Saw the batsman backing away and followed him with a bouncer.
Aaron to Vijay,2 wides,back of a length and slanting down the leg side, the glance doesn't connect and the keeper makes a hash of it to allow an extra run in addition to the wide
Aaron to Duminy,1 wide,short ball angled at leg stump, JP moves across to the off side to pull it down to fine leg but doesn't connect
Aaron to Duminy,no run,slapped away to point and Yuvi tumbles to his right to halt it in its tracks
Aaron to Duminy,1 run,this time he slaps it into the gap in the covers, but there is protection in the deep. Shouldn't offer width if he goes back of a length
Aaron to Vijay,1 run,fires in a yorker just outside off and Vijay guides it to deep third man and we'll have the first strategic time out
anurag: "what happened to Aaron :)" Ten dots in two overs
Arsalan Ahmed: "What are Delhi thinking, leaving Taylor to bat at 6? Whatever happened to giving your impact players more time in the middle to get you to a better score?" Chahal into the attack

Chahal to Vijay, $$OUT$$ ,Vijay's beaten and the off stump is knocked back! What a way to debut for your new franchise! It was a rapid legspinner which drifted in on middle and straightens just enough after pitching. Vijay was looking to guide it down to third man again. A lot of bemused looks as they check if it was bowled or stumped or if the keeper disturbed the bails. The third ump is roped in and replays show he is bowled neck and crop
Ross Taylor is the new batsman
Chahal to Taylor,no run,googly to the new batsman and Taylor had no clue. Gets an inside edge onto pad but there was no short leg
Chahal to Taylor,no run,more turn for his leggies. It's the kind that is just enough to trouble the batsman. Taylor looks to defend and is beaten
Chahal to Taylor,no run,flighted on middle, Taylor plants his bat in front of pad and defends
Chahal to Taylor,1 run,thick outside edge that evades the slips. Taylor was bringing a closed defensive face down on the ball and is deceived
Chahal to Duminy,no run,nice, tight line on off stump. Duminy is forward and blocks
Aaron to Taylor,1 run,back of a length and outside off, steered to deep third man
Aaron to Duminy,no run,presents an angled blade to the back of a length ball outside off. Can't beat point
back over the wicket now

Aaron to Duminy,no run,145kph, another terrific bouncer. Duminy is way too late on the hook shot and it was way too high to control it too. Rose to the crest on the helmet, but the top edge falls just short of the onrushing keeper
Aaron to Duminy,1 run,full and slid across him, driven through to the sweeper
Senthil Mohan: "Delhi badly needs Pietersen here. Not just because of this collapse. They have good players. Just need to gain momentum which can be given only by Pietersen. "
Aaron to Taylor,1 run,taps and runs to point as he rides the bounce on this shortish ball outside off
Around the wicket again
Aaron to Duminy,1 run,wide yorker, Duminy nudges into the covers and races off for the single
Bangalore have taken 50 minutes to complete nine overs
Chahal to Duminy,1 run,tossed up nicely on off stump, he hits it with the turn to deep midwicket
Chahal to Taylor,1 run,stays back to try and read the turn off the deck and dabs it in front of point for a single
Chahal to Duminy,no run,Chahal throws himself to his left and stops the attempted single as Duminy nudged down the ground.

Chahal to Duminy,2 runs,comes down the track and looks to whip through the on side, but this is the wrong 'un and he gets a leading edge that just lobs over the bowler. Chahal leaped as high as he could, but he was just not tall enough
Chahal to Duminy,4 wides,that stayed so low! Gripped the pitch and turned down the leg side and deceived both the batsman and the keeper
Chahal to Taylor,1 run,stays deep in his crease and late cuts it down to deep third man
Chahal to Duminy,no run,he was backing away and ended up struggling to reach a googly that was pitched short and spinning wider of him. Can't beat point
Ashok Dinda now
Dinda to Taylor,1 run,back of a length and outside off, Taylor is back and punches into the covers to bring up the fifty
Dinda to Duminy,1 run,pulls the pace off it this time as he attempts an offcutter which he angles across the left-hander. Duminy steers it down to third man
Dinda to Taylor,1 run,low full toss shaping in at off stump, Taylor was forward and punches to long-off
Dinda to Duminy,2 runs,digs it in short but it doesn't rise high enough. Duminy is in position for the pull and keeps it down nicely. Deep square leg runs around to his right to cut it off
Dinda to Duminy,2 runs,full and outside off, Duminy pushes to mid-off who has a shy at the stumps and gives away an overthrow
Dinda to Duminy,2 runs,picked away off his toes as Dinda search for the blockhole ends up a half-volley. Couple to the left of long-on
Billybob: "Delhi batting line up is all wrong. I mean why is Ross Talyor an quality international player coming in at 6 behind Tiwary and Karthik who are not."
Chahal to Taylor,1 run,drifts it in on off stump and then snares some lovely turn away from the bat. Taylor opens the face and plays it with soft hands into the covers
Chahal to Duminy,no run,the wrong 'un dips on him and Duminy who was expecting the leg spinner was looking for a nudge to midwicket and misses
Chahal to Duminy,1 run,strides down the track and succeeds in getting it to deep midwicket

Chahal to Taylor,1 run,shortish and outside off, Taylor goes back and cuts to point who misfields and the two batsman hesitate in the middle of the pitch wondering if they should go for the single. By the time the ball is taken control of though, they rush through for the single
Chahal to Duminy,1 run
Chahal to Taylor,1 run,flighted on off stump and it skids quite low onto the bat, Taylor pushes to long-off
Sandeep raghuva: "Dinda started again from where he left in the last time.. 9 overs in 1st over.. will expect some more expensive overs from him later on!!"
Dinda to Taylor,1 run,drills the low full toss to the sweeper. He's starting to look comfortable out there
Dinda to Duminy,1 run,opens the face to slice this full delivery outside off to deep cover
Dinda to Taylor,1 wide,goes for the wide yorker but he toes outside the marker

Dinda to Taylor,2 runs,keeps it right up there on off stump, Taylor's forward and drives it through the covers. Starc is very good in the deep as he slides down on it and and throws the ball in one motion
Dinda to Taylor, $$FOUR$$ ,neatly picked away as Dinda goes off line. It was the slower ball off the back of the hand. Taylor knew fine leg was inside the circle and glances it away
Dinda to Taylor,1 run,wide yorker draws him forward as he steers it off the open face to the sweeper
Dinda to Duminy,1 run,full and outside off, Duminy pushes to long-off
Sagar: "50% dot balls, not acceptable. Delhi should get back to basics and minimize dots and rotate strike... good bowling by B'lore"
JP Duminy has become the 40th batsman to score 1000 runs in the tournament. Here's Yuvraj Singh with the ball
Yuvraj Singh to Duminy,1 run,comes down the track to take advantage of the flight. Meets it on the full and whips it between long-on and deep midwicket
Yuvraj Singh to Taylor,1 run,shortish and outside off, he rocks back and cuts to deep point
Yuvraj Singh to Duminy,1 run,quicker and flatter on off stump, he goes back and punches to long-on
Yuvraj Singh to Taylor,1 run,loads of flight on this as Taylor lashes to the sweeper
Yuvraj Singh to Duminy,no run,stays a bit low as he tosses it up outside off. Goes on with the arm as JP bottom edges it
Yuvraj Singh to Duminy,1 run,flighted on middle, Duminy pushes it down the ground to long-on. That's the second and final strategic time out of the innings
Chahal to Duminy,1 run,googly to start and this time Duminy is aware of it, goes back and punches it down to long-off
Chahal to Taylor,1 run,such lovely drift he's getting. Sneaks in towards leg stump but it gets some turn after pitching and takes the outside edge towards point
Chahal to Duminy,1 run,rocks back and cuts to deep point
Chahal to Taylor,no run,this almost turned square! Loads of flight just outside off and lured the batsman into pushing at it. Gripped the deck and spun well past the outside edge

Chahal to Taylor,no run,that could have been close! It was a shorter ball and he looked to dab it in front of point for a quick single. Kohli swoops on the ball and sends in the throw in one motion. Rosco has to pull out a full-length dive as well and it saves him, just about
Chahal to Taylor,no run,goes for the late cut, but still can't beat Kohli
Yuvraj Singh to Duminy, $$SIX$$ ,peppers the sightscreen after skipping down the track. Yuvi fires in a flatter ball but he get under the ball and muscled it over the top
Yuvraj Singh to Duminy,1 run,shortish and darted in on off stump, he shuffles across and works it wide of where mid-on would have been. Yuvi himself rushes after it
Yuvraj Singh to Taylor,1 run,he's concentrating on a quicker pace now after that six. Taylor stays back and cuts behind point.
Yuvraj Singh to Duminy,1 run,punched down the ground to long-on where AB is lurking. No double there
Yuvraj Singh to Taylor,1 run,this time there was flight available, but Taylor is not quite comfortable against the slower bowlers. Misses out as his swipe can only reach deep midwicket
Yuvraj Singh to Duminy,1 run,shortish ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
Mitchell Starc comes back
Starc to Duminy,1 no ball,pulls out the scoop, but it wasn't the right ball for it. Leg-stump yorker that wanders through to the keeper. Oh, but wait, he has overstepped!
$$Free$$ $$hit$$ $$ball$$
Starc to Duminy,1 run,slower short ball and Duminy was just a little too exuberant. Mistimes the pull and finds deep square leg
Around the wicket

Starc to Taylor,2 runs,excellent work from Dinda at the third man boundary! Short and wide outside off as he threw his bat at it. Gets a thick outside edge that seemed set for four, but he hunted it down well
Starc to Taylor,1 run,sets himself up well outside off and Starc bowls it full and further wide, slices it away to deep point
zaheer: "Chahal record has been if not excellent then very good so far in T20s, 20 wkts in 28 odd matches and most imp. having an economy under 6 is brilliant."
Starc to Duminy,2 runs,fires it in full on middle stump as Duminy clears his front leg and squeezes it out to the right of deep midwicket
Starc to Duminy,1 run,low full toss on leg stump, swung away to deep square leg
Starc to Taylor,no run,has a giant smile on his face after executing the perfect wide yorker to keep Taylor quiet
NAUGHTY BLOOM: "With Neesham and Parnel yet to come, Delhi can definitely look to put a fighting total on board.. I can smell 140-45 on the board!!"
Dinda to Duminy,2 runs,full on off stump, drilled past Virat at mid-off but he hares after it and keeps it to a couple
Dinda to Duminy, $$SIX$$ ,misses the mark with his length and Duminy gets under it and smacks it beyond the long-off boundary. So clean
Dinda to Duminy, $$FOUR$$ ,cleared his front leg away to whip the fuller delivery on leg stump away to the square leg boundary. Such quick hands and that's his fifty as well
Dinda to Duminy,1 run,switches to a slower pace as he goes for the offcutter outside off, Duminy goes back and cuts to deep point
Dinda to Taylor,no run,that's better. He gets his yorker right and it's quick enough to beat Taylor's lash outside off stump
Dinda to Taylor,1 run,goes for the slower ball and it ends up a low full toss, Taylor steers it to deep point
Starc to Taylor,no run,heaves down the wrong line and misses out on a length delivery. Starc better be a lot fuller or a lot shorter than that

Starc to Taylor, $$FOUR$$ ,blindly swings again and this time he gets the benefit of a thick outside edge that scurries away to the third man boundary. That was the offcutter and it did deceive the batsman
Starc to Taylor,no run,knows Taylor was setting up for the fuller ball and gives him a short one. Isn't able to adjust and misses on the pull shot. Kicks the turf in disgust

Starc to Taylor, $$FOUR$$ ,another slower ball as he rolls his fingers down the side of the ball. Taylor plants his front foot down the line and goes for that big golf swing again. Another outside edge, another third man boundary. Starc throws his head back
Starc to Taylor,1 run,swiped away into the leg side as this is fullish on middle and leg
Starc to Duminy, $$FOUR$$ ,there were two before it but this is the first one off the middle. Clears his front leg to lash a fullish delivery over the head of Kohli at mid-off

Dinda to Taylor, $$FOUR$$ ,starts off with a full toss that is way too wide to become anything but a boundary through point. Taylor had to reach for it but he did manage to connect it well enough to beat the boundary rider
Dinda to Taylor,2 runs,full and outside off again as Taylor lashes it right through Yuvi at backward point. But third man mops up

Dinda to Taylor,no run,he's disgusted with himself after missing out on that. Smacks his pad with the bat as this full length ball that was asking to be smashed out of the ground ends up not even getting an edge
Dinda to Taylor,1 run,wide yorker drilled down the ground to bring up the hundred partnership
Dinda to Duminy, $$SIX$$ ,mauled into the crowd behind deep midwicket! It was the slower ball and he'd picked it early and though the bat turned in his hands, it sailed past the ropes

Dinda to Duminy, $$FOUR$$ ,deep midwicket has a chance this time but Maddinson has rushed in too much and makes a mess of what should have been a simple catch. Low full toss on middle and Duminy hoicked it off the front foot and gets a boundary for his trouble

$$8.15$$ $$pm$$  It was all Bangalore in the first six-seven overs but Delhi hung in there and exploded in the final overs. JP Duminy provided the momentum and his 67 off 48 has set up a "competitive total" according to him. There were a couple of gaffes in the field in the final two overs and Ashok Dinda leaked over 50 in his spell

"Unfortunate to lose as many wickets at the top," says Duminy, "After 10 overs we knew we can get around to 140. Definitely competitive. It's a two-paced pitch, new ball had variable bounce. First six overs is key. Hopefully I can make a dent too"

"They got away from us a bit in the last four overs," Albie Morkel said. "It's a bit slow and it's tough to play aggressive shots. [Strong top six but] We're gonna have to bat well. We still have to get those runs, swing with the new ball and if we can get through that and build a foundation."
greecedevil: "and that's half centuries for Duminy and Dinda!!! Kohli will not be a good captain. Aaron and Albie did not finish their quotas even when they are much better than Dinda."
Here come Banglaore's openers. Parthiv Patel and Nic Maddinson, sporting a Draco Malfoy hairstyle.
JP Duminy to bowl, getting the ball to spin away to the left-handers
Duminy to Patel,no run,length ball is pushed back towards the bowler
Duminy to Patel,no run,looking to push this towards mid-on, misses and is hit on the pads, that was sliding down
Duminy to Patel,no run,pushed towards cover this time
Duminy to Patel,1 run,first run for Bangalore, steered towards cover
Duminy to Maddinson, $$FOUR$$ ,Maddinson has a reputation for being a hitter, he starts off his innings by skipping down and launching the ball over the off side, in front of point  for four
Duminy to Maddinson,no run,blocked off the back foot towards point
Ashok Dinda not the most popular man among Cricinfo readers at the moment.
Mohammed Shami to Patel,1 run,short of length ball from Shami, nurdles the ball towards square leg for a single
Mohammed Shami to Maddinson,no run,cramps up Maddinson, back of length once more, Maddinson squirts that away to the leg side
Mohammed Shami to Maddinson,no run,beaten outside off, great line there, bounce as well as he drops it a touch shorter
Idrees Kanchwal: "Dinda clearly must be getting more tweets now than even kohli "
Mohammed Shami to Maddinson,no run,again not given much room for Maddinson, following him on legstump, defended

Mohammed Shami to Maddinson, $$OUT$$ ,there's the first wicket for Delhi, a shortish ball down the leg side, wasn't the most threatening delivery, Maddinson wanted to pull that away, can only glove it away, easy catch for the keeper
Here's Kohli
Mohammed Shami to Kohli, $$FOUR$$ ,great effort from the keeper Karthik there, flinging himself to his left to nearly grab that one off Kohli, who just glanced that leg-side delivery
Parnell to Patel,no run,short of length ball outside off, defended towards point
Parnell to Patel,2 runs,drops it shorter, defended for a single, and there is amisfield as there's some awkward bounce for Mayank Agarwal
Parnell to Patel, $$FOUR$$ ,this is a shot Parthiv plays well, the ball is dropped short by Parnell, Parthiv is quickly onto it, pulling it away in front of midwicket for four
Parnell to Patel,no run,Parthiv defends this one
Parnell to Patel,no run,a yorker from Parnell, 140.4kph, Parthiv gets his bat down in time to keep that one out
Parnell to Patel,1 run,this time the pull doesn't quite work, a bottom edge onto the body as he throws his bat at that one
Mohammed Shami to Patel,no run,140kph, just too much pace. Angles a bouncer across him and Parthiv looks to drag it into the leg side with a pull. Comfortably beaten
Mohammed Shami to Patel,no run,his shot selection is better this time but Shami manages a bit of seam away from this back of a length delivery and beats him again
Mohammed Shami to Patel,1 wide,I though that hit the thigh pad but the umpire reckons there was no contact. Back of a length down the leg side. He goes for the flick and has no success connecting
Mohammed Shami to Patel,2 runs,this one doesn't rise and Parthiv latches onto a pull to deep midwicket
Abhishek Jayswa: "Not popular?? Dinda is favorite bowler of all Delhi supporters."
Mohammed Shami to Patel,no run,139kph, another terrific bouncer! Parthiv continues taking it his hook shot had no chance of connecting. Little question asked but he hadn't touched that
Mohammed Shami to Patel, $$FOUR$$ ,what a response! Charges him and pummels the fuller delivery to the long-on boundary.
Mohammed Shami to Patel, $$FOUR$$ ,goes down again and it made an awkward clink as it struck the bat on the splice. Just about clears a back-pedaling mid-off and scurries away
Parnell to Kohli,no run,fullish and around the off stump, defended off the front foot
slip in place for Kohli
Parnell to Kohli,no run,gets back in line with the shortish ball and flicks to midwicket
Parnell to Kohli,no run,hint of seam away and Kohli has to check his back-foot punch into the covers
Parnell to Kohli, $$FOUR$$ ,full and angled across him, Kohli swings from the crease and gets a thick outside edge that flies away to the third man boundary, despite Rahul Sharma's tumbling effort

Parnell to Kohli,1 run,143kph, shortish and angled across him, Kohli looks to steer it down to third man but bottom edges it. The non-striker sees the ball going into a gap behind the wickets and rushes up for a single
Parnell to Patel, $$FOUR$$ ,spots the batsman charging and digs it in short, but makes the mistake of bowling wide. Parthiv slaps it over point. Thumping boundary
Shahbaz Nadeem is into the attack, with the beginnings of a Hashim Amla beard
anshu: "Patel has habit of getting out on leg spinner often trying big shots, Rahul Sharma has good chance against him and Kohli too as pitch is double paced"
Nadeem to Kohli,1 run,flat delivery to start off and Kohli stays on the back foot and pushes to long-off

Nadeem to Patel, $$SIX$$ ,bowls a terrible long hop and Parthiv shuffles across and mauls it miles into the square leg boundary. Kohli enjoyed that. Smacked it out of the ground and we need a new ball
Nadeem to Patel,no run,he was moving outside off again and Nadeem follows him with a fuller delivery. The slash doesn't beat point
Nadeem to Patel, $$FOUR$$ ,pulls out the sweep and it's timed extremely well. He's not bothered with keeping the ball down and why should he when he hits it in the gap
Nadeem to Patel,1 run,pushed through on off stump as Parthiv taps it into the covers and goes to the other end
Nadeem to Kohli,1 run,flighted on off stump, Kohli calmly pushes it to long-on to raise his team's fifty. That's also the strategic time-out

Inu Mhase: "I wanted to see Gayle and Patel opening the batting today.. Interesting to see how the 2 guys with exactly opposite postures looks at the crease.. Would Patel be visible??" Here's Duminy from around the stumps
Duminy to Kohli,no run,goes on with the arm as Kohli taps it to backward point
Duminy to Kohli,no run,shimmies down the pitch but he pulls the length back and Kohli can only nudge it to square leg
Yuvi's waiting under the helmet
Duminy to Kohli,2 runs,a little too straight with a good length ball and Kohli clips it away to long leg
Duminy to Kohli,1 run,flatter delivery on middle and off, Kohli's wrists though work the ball to deep square leg
Duminy to Patel,1 run,judges the ball to be short and he waits on the back foot before whipping it down to long-on
Duminy to Kohli,1 run,punched to the right of long-on as they milk the offspinner
Nadeem to Kohli,no run,flights outside off and gets a bit of turn off this deck. Kohli is lured into poking at it and it goes down to point
Nadeem to Kohli,no run,comes down the track and thumps it into the covers
Nadeem to Kohli,2 runs,skids in with the arm, but it had started short and Kohli slaps it away to the sweeper
Nadeem to Kohli,1 run,flighted on middle but he had come down the track and made room for himself to drive to long-off
rahul: "@Inu Mhase: Haven't you seen Patel and Hayden batted together when opening together for Chennai:)"
Nadeem to Patel,no run,clears his front leg to chop this short ball on middle into the covers
Nadeem to Patel,1 wide,terrible delivery as he bowls it flat and well down the leg side. Parthiv looks to help it away, but doesn't succeed
Nadeem to Patel,1 run,he almost falls over in his attempt to make room. So much effort into his shots and it only ends up a single to long-off as he flat-bats the short ball
Rahul Sharma's legspinners now
Sharma to Patel,no run,goes for a big appeal as he sweeps across the line of a good length ball. But the impact was outside off
Sharma to Patel,1 run
Sharma to Kohli,no run,tossed up on off stump, Kohli lunges forward and blocks into the covers
Sharma to Kohli,1 run,makes room outside leg as he advances and drills the shortish ball through the covers
Sharma to Patel, $$OUT$$ ,races blindly down the track and goes for a hack across the line. The ball, a simple one on a good length, sneaks between bat and pad and rattles into off stump
It's Yuvi and Kohli at the crease again
Sharma to Yuvraj Singh,1 run,gets a bit of turn as he pushes the batsman back in his crease. Flicked to long leg

Harish: "Patel has been doing the same thing ever since he played for India when he was 17 . Hit few great shots , get into the twenties or thirties , get out . That's why he has'nt lived that much in our hearts neither in the team . "
Pace against Yuvi, Shami's back
Mohammed Shami to Yuvraj Singh,no run,predictably its the short ball on middle and off stump. Yuvi has to jump off his feet and drop it at his feet with soft hands
Mohammed Shami to Yuvraj Singh,1 wide,short delivery that is just a shade down the leg side. That's rather harsh as the ball sailed over his hips as he was a little cramped up while playing the pull

Mohammed Shami to Yuvraj Singh, $$FOUR$$ ,that was a snorter of a bouncer. The eyes came off the ball and he was mostly taking evasive action when the bat sort or jutted out and the top edge was taken to run away to the boundary at long leg
Mohammed Shami to Yuvraj Singh,no run,goes fullish on leg stump and Yuvi is rooted to the crease as he blocks
Mohammed Shami to Yuvraj Singh,1 run,stands and hoicks and the bat turns in his hands and he skies the ball over the slips. Taylor ran back but couldn't get under it
Mohammed Shami to Kohli,no run,rock-solid forward defensive from Kohli at the other end
Mohammed Shami to Kohli,no run,fullish on off stump, he goes forward and blocks into the covers. Searches for the single to keep strike but Yuvi says no
Sharma to Yuvraj Singh, $$SIX$$ ,away she goes. Flat, hard and just over the ropes. Sharma flighted it on leg stump and he swung for the fences

Sharma to Yuvraj Singh,1 run,blazed down the ground! Another one that's flighted on off stump and it was struck with considerable disdain. Vijay had to pull out a top effort to stop that. Kohli was in trouble of being beheaded there
Sharma to Kohli,1 run,full toss on off stump, Kohli flicks to deep midwicket. Took the toe end there
Sharma to Yuvraj Singh,no run,strides down the wicket to block the flighted delivery that is pushed across him
Sharma to Yuvraj Singh,1 run,charges him again and he yorks himself. Jams the bat down on the ball and collects a single to point
Sharma to Kohli,1 run,tapped away through the covers. Sharma tries to toss this up outside Kohli's reach as he was advancing but it was easily controlled
Jimmy Neesham takes over from Shami
Neesham to Kohli,1 run,skips down the track and thumps it down to long-off. The bat turns in his hands, Kohli's timing hasn't been all that impressive in this innings
Yuvraj is surveying the field. Deep backwards square leg and Long-off are back
Neesham to Yuvraj Singh,no run,looks to ramp it to third man as he waits for the short ball, but does it a second longer. Not pleased with himself

Neesham to Yuvraj Singh, $$FOUR$$ ,that sat up for Yuvi and he's walloped it to the square leg boundary. Neesh bowls waist-high short ball and it was the slower one as well. Comfortably dispatched. The ball seems to have caught the cables of the spider-cam and usually it provides grounds for a dead ball, but the umpires give a little leeway
Neesham to Yuvraj Singh,no run,comes down the track and carves a full and wide delivery to point
Neesham to Yuvraj Singh,1 run,another back of the hand slower ball which Yuvi steers behind point and Kohli scurries through for a quick single
Neesham to Kohli,1 run,big ol full toss and Kohli has calmly slapped it away to the sweeper

Rajat: "Yuvi is best when he is trying to behead the partner at other end. Hopefully I don't jinx him :)" He seems to be getting that swing back, yes. Except Shami's pace troubled him big time. Anyway, it's Wayne Parnell now

Parnell to Kohli,1 run,that's a dolly and he's  $$dropped$$  it at short fine leg! Neesham, what have you done?! Clipped uppishly but straight to the man, at abound waist high and at a very comfortable pace coming at him. But it pops in and then pops out
Parnell to Yuvraj Singh,no run,stays back to steer the good length ball behind point
Parnell to Yuvraj Singh,no run
Parnell to Yuvraj Singh,1 run,bit of room on offer and he essays a late cut to find deep third man
Amit: "Surely Shami had to stay on there and try to finish Yuvraj off. Karthik can't afford to take this down to the last over - not enough runs to play with."

Parnell to Kohli,no run,skips down the track but the ball seems to stop on the pitch before reaching him. Gets hit high on the bat as he pushes into the covers. Fell not too far away from the fielder either

Parnell to Kohli,1 run,another  $$drop$$  and it's Agarwal in the square boundary on the off side. Raced down the track and slapped a short ball hard and flat. the fielder had to run in and come forward but he spills it
Neesham to Kohli, $$SIX$$ ,do not drop me, says Kohli with a punishing six over extra cover. Overpitched outside off and he waded into the shot and timed it perfectly
Neesham to Kohli,1 run,whipped away into the leg side as those strong wrists take over
Neesham to Yuvraj Singh,1 run,waist-high full toss and Yuvi swipes it away to deep square leg
Neesham to Kohli,no run,outside edge off the slower ball outside off. Tries to steer it down to third man but it bounces short of the keeper
Salman1508: "Is Kohli trying to be Yuvi here? "
Neesham to Kohli,1 run,full on off stump, Kohli drills it down to long-on

Neesham to Yuvraj Singh, $$SIX$$ ,fullish and outside leg stump and Yuvi's helped it on its way. Lands among the Bangalore players in the dug out and he has a big smile on his face while punching gloves with his captain
Rahul Sharma's back
Sharma to Kohli, $$SIX$$ ,and he's sent packing over long-on. Races down and gets to the pitch. Doesn't bother about how it's going to turn and just launches it into the night sky

Sharma to Kohli, $$SIX$$ ,this one is hit with the turn and he's raises the fifty partnership with a glorious shot over extra cover. Didn't get to the pitch as much as the last ball and had to sort of reach for it, but his timing was still top-notch
Sharma to Kohli,1 run,stays back as he knows this will be flatter and clips it to deep midwicket
Sharma to Yuvraj Singh, $$SIX$$ ,drags it short as he fears Yuvi's trip down the track. But it was such a long hop that he has time to pull it to the long leg boundary
Sharma to Yuvraj Singh,no run,backs away to the flatter ball outside off and chops it to cover
Sharma to Yuvraj Singh,1 run,short again but this was just a touch quicker and Yuvi pulls to long-on. That is now the strategic time out
Harshal: "@Salman. Maybe, but even when Kohli's not in good nick, he's still going at better than a run a ball."
Jude: "In the space of 2 overs RR came down from 8.1 to 4.4. Remarkable effort and game lost the balance well behind" Prompts Shami to come back into the attack
Mohammed Shami to Yuvraj Singh,1 run,slower ball outside off, Yuvi waits for it and thumps it to deep cover
Mohammed Shami to Kohli,1 run,overpitched outside off, Kohli's flashing blade gives work for the sweeper
Mohammed Shami to Yuvraj Singh,no run,slower short ball and he's deceived Yuvi. Set up for the pull shot and then realises it was not coming on and just lets it through to the keeper
Mohammed Shami to Yuvraj Singh,no run,spears it in on middle and he was looking to clip to midwicket. Gets a leading edge to point. Squared Yuvi up there. Shami's been brilliant today
Mohammed Shami to Yuvraj Singh,no run,another slower bouncer and though Yuvi goes through with the shot this time he has trouble connecting
Mohammed Shami to Yuvraj Singh, $$SIX$$ ,long-on watches it clear his head and thud into the advertising boards. Pitches it up in his arc and Yuvi's big back lift comes down in a thunderous swing
sree: "Karthik has a lot to learn as captain. When you have Kohli and Yuvi batting with 58 needed off 45 balls, you go for wickets, not for economy. economy doesn't work on these guys!"
Nadeem to Kohli,1 run,low full toss to start his spell and Kohli drives to long-on
Nadeem to Yuvraj Singh, $$SIX$$ ,terrible line from Nadeem. On the pads and he's swept him miles into the boundary behind square leg. Yuvi against this kind of spin is no contest at all.
Nadeem to Yuvraj Singh,(no ball)  $$FOUR$$ ,that's a full toss over the waist and he has pulled it over short find leg to take him to his fifty on Bangalore debut
Nadeem to Yuvraj Singh,1 run,flighted on off stump, he lunges forward to block and picks up a single square on the off side

Nadeem to Kohli,1 run,races down the track and lofts it down towards long-on. Falls short of Vijay who was diving forward. They pick up the runs needed to pick up the victory and a very comprehensive one at that
That's this game done and dusted. Tomorrow is a double header, so join us at 4 pm as the caravan continues gathering momentum. This is Alagappan Muthu, happy to type my last word tonight

$$Yuzvendra$$ $$Chahal$$ $$is$$ $$Man$$ $$of$$ $$the$$ $$Match$$  "Its my second match in the IPL, I played one for Mumbai. I got confidence seeing the first ball turn. It is great to have the support of the captain Kohli, choosing me as the spinner over a player like Murali in the squad"

"That's what I was telling Yuvi in the middle, if those were mis-hits they wouldn't have gone to hand" Virat Kohli says. "It was a 170-plus track and to hold them down to 145 was big. Chahal did extremely well, Varun as well and Mitch too. [Yuvraj]He's won us two world cups, he's a proven match-winner and it's important to back a player like that."

"Didn't bat well enough though Taylor and Duminy had a great partnership," says  $$Dinesh$$ $$Karthik$$ , the stand-in captain for Delhi. "They batted well, kept playing their shots, came off, bad fielding. It looks like that when the opponent is hammering you. It's the first game of the season and we're getting used to who performs which role and it's important for us to learn and come back in the next game. Duminy absorbed the pressure brilliantly and hit some lusty blows at the end"

"About 90% runs of Yuvi came off bad deliveries today. I missed those sweet cover drives and classy late cuts off good deliveries that find the boundary more often than not." Those might not be too far off, Sahil

$$9.45$$ $$pm$$  Kohli jumps on Yuvi as they walk back to the pavilion savouring a job well done. Their bowlers set things up by blasting out the Delhi top order. They stuck in there when Duminy and Taylor were building that partnership and in the chase Yuvraj Singh found form with 52 off 29. He was treated to some terrible bowling and he took complete advantage

name: Delhi Daredevils v Royal Challengers Bangalore
Royal Challengers Bangalore v Kolkata Knight Riders

commentary.text: Gambhir and Bisla to open. Henriques has the new ball
Follow this game on our new-age social scorecard. The  $$ESPNcricinfo$$ $$Match$$ $$Companion$$  is the only platform where cricket meets social media.
$$3.30$$ $$pm$$ $$Kohli$$ $$wins$$ $$the$$ $$toss$$ $$and$$ $$RCB$$ $$will$$ $$bowl$$

Kohli says RCB want to make use of some grass on the pitch and feels it will settle down later in the evening.  $$KL$$ $$Rahul$$ , the young Karnataka batsman, comes in for left-arm spinner Murali Kartik, indicating how Kohli expects the pitch to play

Two, in fact, three changes for KKR. Pradeep Sangwan is in for Laxmi Ratan Shukla. Brett Lee makes way for Ryan McLaren. Indian fast bowler in for Indian allrounder, overseas fast bowler out for overseas allrounder. And Balaji takes his place back from Shami Ahmed
Matt: "Why, why why is BMac not playing? I thought KKR had batting issues..."
Siddarth: "So now we have the bowling mentor(lee) sitting out with his disciples playing.. see the IPL can do strange things :)"
$$3.15$$ $$pm$$  Hello, hello, another double header today, the first one in Bangalore, the second in Pune.

RCB's season so far - a close win, a close defeat, and a thrashing of Sunrisers. KKR's season so far - a comprehensive win followed by a comprehensive defeat. Here's what Gautam Gambhir  $$has$$ $$to$$ $$say$$ . Also here is that keen blogger Ryan ten Doeschate on how  $$the$$ $$KKR$$ $$support$$ $$staff$$  get the side through the maddening schedule of the IPL.
Pariksheet: "Going by the law of average, Virat Kohli won't be among the runs today. That leaves Gayle to be the obvious choice for my Fantasy team captain."

Ahmad: "Ryan ten Doeschate is paying the price of not being a star or from a leading test playing nation. About time he gets a go in this IPL , KKR dont want to be in a position , later in the tournament , where they require players who have only been warming benches."

----------------------------------------------------------------------- We are back to where it all began. RCB v KKR at the Chinnaswamy. Anyone remember the stunning  $$Game$$ $$1$$ $$of$$ $$the$$ $$first$$ $$ever$$ $$IPL$$ , when Brendon McCullum went bonkers in Bangalore?
McCullum has joined the KKR line-up in time for this game. Can he help them turn it around today? Here's  $$the$$ $$preview$$  to the game.

In case McCullum plays, you might want to have him in your  $$Fantasy$$ $$XI$$ . There are daily prizes to be won, so who knows. Make your Fantasy changes now, for both matches today. Reckon KKR can stop RCB in their tracks?  $$Predict$$  the results of the IPL games, and get in line for some really cool prizes.

While you wait for the game to start... Ever seen a cricket match being played on a railway track? Check out our fan gallery on  $$The$$ $$Stands$$ . You could have your cricket pictures featured here too.  $$Here's$$ $$how$$ .
Henriques to Bisla,no run,swinging away very full, around off, patted away softly
Henriques to Bisla,1 wide,angled down the leg side on a good length
Wide slip
Henriques to Bisla,no run,flashes at a pitched up outswinger widish outside off and is beaten
Henriques to Bisla,no run,angled in to off now, fullish and straightening, he eases it towards mid off

Henriques to Bisla,1 run,pushes a length ball softly from the crease, it rolls on the pitch towards leg, Henriques after it, Gambhir after the run, they collide, Gambhir makes it, and exchanges a cold stare with the bowler
Henriques to Gambhir,1 run,short and into the body, hooked confidently to deep square
More words between Gambhir and Henriques

Henriques to Bisla, $$OUT$$ ,the Henriques move works for RCB, he strikes first over, short outside off,  Bisla on his toes to try and cut it, spoons it to point, it is dying in front of him, he tumbles to take it
RP Singh
Singh to Gambhir,no run,banged in short as Gambhir comes out right away, he adjusts to push it to off

Singh to Gambhir,no run,short again, Gambhir cannot time the cut, too much bounce, Kohli charges across from cover, Gambhir wants the single and is halfway down the pitch, Kallis sends his back, Gambhir had no chance had Kohli's throw hit, but the fielder was off balance and got rid of the ball too soon
Singh to Gambhir,no run,turned to square leg, again Gambhir is rather eager to take the run, not getting it
Singh to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,short again, and now Gambhir is ready to crack it past cover
Singh to Gambhir,2 runs,almost plays on a flail to a back of a length ball outside off, rolls past the keeper who is not able to stop it
Singh to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,shot! Gambhir's come out and lofted this cleanly and powerfully over extra cover's jump
vibhash: "Not sure if Kohli was trying to hit stumps or Gambhir on that throw. His missed Gambhir with a lesser distance than the stumps."
Henriques to Kallis,no run,shortish and swinging away, lots of bounce, left alone
Henriques to Kallis,no run,stifled appeal for lbw as Kallis misses the whip to leg and is hit on the pad
Henriques to Kallis,1 run,this time he connects with a very full one on the pads and sends it to fine leg
Henriques to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,nice, on the pads again, and Gambhir picks it elegantly off middle and leg, and sends it racing in the air through midwicket
Henriques to Gambhir,no run,shortish, outside off, attempted dab from Gambhir, and he's beaten
Henriques to Gambhir,2 runs,waits a touch and runs a length ball wide of third man, Murali tries to stop the ball with his foot, slight fumble and they take two
Unadkat
Unadkat to Kallis,no run,pitched up, around off, driven to extra cover
Unadkat to Kallis,no run,wider, Kallis goes harder at it, mishits the drive to mid off
Unadkat to Kallis,no run,slower one from Unadkat now, Kallis surprised, starts to go for the drive, then tries to run it fine in the end, misses

Unadkat to Kallis, $$FOUR$$ ,Kallis is let off, he was getting impatient, mishit a slog to midwicket, Kohli went for the non-striker's stumps, missed and there was no one backing up, Unadkat can;t even let out his frustration
Unadkat to Kallis,no run,beaten again outside off with one angled slowly across
Unadkat to Kallis,1 run,walks out now, tries to work it to leg, gets a leading edge to covers for a tight single
Henriques to Kallis,no run
Henriques to Kallis,no run,this time he times the straight drive well, but Henriques gets the right foot across in time even as he falls over
Henriques to Kallis, $$FOUR$$ ,no stopping this, Kallis moves out and towards leg, creates space and lifts a length ball over the bowler
Henriques to Kallis,1 run,chops a length ball down to third man
Henriques to Gambhir,no run,tries to come down and go through the off side, can;t connect with a length ball close to off
Henriques to Gambhir,1 run,this came in from outside off, he guides it to third man
Alabhya: "Kallis is looking off-colour yet again. KKR needs his solidity for middle order to perform."
Muralitharan comes on
Muralitharan to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,comes down right away, tossed up delivery, he takes it on the full and puts it away through extra cover
Muralitharan to Gambhir,1 no ball,tries to sweep one angled in full, misses, no-ball signalled, free hit coming up, that is a big no ball
Muralitharan to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,Gambhir bends the knee and heaves from outside off, and gets enough connection to hit it over mid on
Muralitharan to Gambhir,1 run,Gambhir flowing as always against spin, goes back and across and nudges off the pads to square leg

Muralitharan to Kallis,1 run,spins in sharply from outside off, Kallis nudges it behind square, short fine leg throws it to the keeper, who breaks the stumps but the ball is out of his hand, Gambhir would have made it anyway
Muralitharan to Gambhir,no run

Muralitharan to Gambhir,2 runs,that hurried into the left-hander with the angle, he went back to drag a pull in the air over square leg, Gambhir has to dive in for the second, better throw would have had him in trouble, it was a wide one
Ram: "GG reaches 30+, gets out playing a rash shot. This seems to be the general trend. Will he change it this time around?"
Vinay Kumar on
Vinay Kumar to Kallis,1 run,good length just outside off, dabbed to third man
round the stumps
Vinay Kumar to Gambhir,no run,tries to pull a short and wide one outside off, misses
Vinay Kumar to Gambhir,no run,he's eyeing the leg side, turns it from outside off to midwicket, falls short of Gayle tumbling to his right
Vinay Kumar to Gambhir,no run,beaten now as he flashes to a length ball outside off
Vinay Kumar to Gambhir,1 run,slices a pitched up delivery down to third man
Vinay Kumar to Kallis,1 run,length ball on off and middle, pushed down to long on
Carlos: "Kohli is too aggressive to be dhoni's successor...May be 20/20 and ODI but test matches no way......way tooo aggressive"
Muralitharan to Kallis,1 run,eases a tossed up ball to long on
Muralitharan to Gambhir,1 run,shortish and angled in, pulled to deep square leg
Muralitharan to Kallis,1 run,swept from outside off, but straight to deep square
Muralitharan to Gambhir,no run,comes down the track, tries to push to off, off the inner part of the bat to the bowler
Muralitharan to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,tossed up on middle, slogged hard, slogged cleanly to the deep midwicket boundary
Muralitharan to Gambhir,no run,well played in the end, goes back to a length ball and cuts from close to off, diving stop at backward point by AB
Vinay Kumar to Kallis, $$OUT$$ ,Kallis has picked out sweeper cover, he was struggling to time them, comes out, backing away towards leg, and swings hard, straight into the hands of the fielder
Abhishek: "Seems like Murali's powers are waning.It's time for RCB to give Vettori a go.He can be useful with the bat too!!!"
Vinay Kumar to Gambhir,1 run,dropped softly behind square on off for a quick single
Vinay Kumar to Pathan, $$FOUR$$ ,he's lifted his first ball over the bowler for four, pitched up, he plonks front foot and goes through with the swing, easy
Vinay Kumar to Pathan, $$FOUR$$ ,powerful cut, widish from Vinay and YK's flashed it past backward point's dive
Vinay Kumar to Pathan, $$FOUR$$ ,lovely wrists, YK on fire, short, into the body, but not getting up too much, he swats it behind square even as he swivels, no chance for fine leg
Vinay Kumar to Pathan,1 run,presses right forward to push towards covers for a single
Sharad Sharma: "Yusuf! You are not on my fantasy team. Please stop."
Hasan: "Any deal available today on Yusuf Pathan ?" All discount sales cancelled on early signs
Muralitharan to Pathan,1 leg bye,comes forward to a slowly tossed up offspinner and gets it behind square leg, Murali appeals for lbw, that wasn't a bad shout, probably too much angle with the turn
Muralitharan to Gambhir,1 leg bye,goes back outside leg to a tossed up delivery angled in, rolls fine off pad
Muralitharan to Pathan,1 run,nicely stretching forward to nudge to square leg
Muralitharan to Gambhir,1 run,goes back again to a length ball and punches to the sweeper
Muralitharan to Pathan,no run,looks to stretch forward, it is flighted fuller, he softly defends onto the pitch
Muralitharan to Pathan,no run,quicker offbreak nudged to square leg
ankur: "Why is it so that players perform so well when we do not include them in our fantasy team :'( :'("
RP Singh back
Singh to Gambhir,1 run,first ball Gambhir walks across and down the pitch, but cannot time the clip off the pad, in the air down to deep square
Singh to Pathan,no run,yorker, on off stump, patted back to the bowler
Singh to Pathan,1 run,he gets away, swings hard at a short ball, edge flies over short extra cover and lands at vacant mid off
Singh to Gambhir,1 run,angled in full at leg, he drives it down to long off
Singh to Pathan,2 runs,hasn;t timed this pull, got it from close to the toe end, still deep square has a lot of ground to cover and has to slide across to stop the boundary
Singh to Pathan,1 run,overpitched just outside off, drilled powerfully down the ground, long off fields
Unadkat back
Unadkat to Pathan, $$SIX$$ ,this could be YK's evening, he's picked this length ball casually from off, and it's flown high into the crowd beyond the deep square leg rope
Unadkat to Pathan,1 run,wanted to go big on the leg side again, saw this was slightly shorter and wider, he drops it softly to point
Unadkat to Gambhir,no run,short, around off, Gambhir tries to reach for it, but misses
Unadkat to Gambhir,1 run,goes across and runs a back of a length  ball down to third man
Unadkat to Pathan,1 run,close, very close, pushes off the front foot towards extra cover, Kohli with the one-handed pick-up and lob, misses once again, Yusuf is relieved
Unadkat to Gambhir,1 run,chopped down to third man for one
Krish: "If it's Yusuf's evening, it's the death of all the fantasy teams."
Henriques to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,Gambhir shuffles outside off, bends the knee and times the paddle high over square leg
Henriques to Gambhir,1 run,across and outside off to try it again, sees it wider outside off and runs it to third man
Henriques to Pathan,1 run,shortish, not much bounce, swatted wide of deep square, they'll have to settle for one, got to the fielder quickly
Henriques to Gambhir,1 run,overpitched, around off, mistimes a forcing stroke down to long off
Nas: "All these praises for Yusuf is going to make him throw away his wicket"

Henriques to Pathan, $$OUT$$ ,and YK;s holed out, straight into the hands of long on, slower one, attempted legcutter that's drifted in fullish, he can't resist it and has a go, picks out the man in the deep
Some timing, Nas
Henriques to Tiwary,1 run,runs it wide of backward point for one
Kartik: "@Nas: you have a bright future in commentary... what a curse , omg , my captain , sob ....."
Darshil: "@ Nas.. Just gave my board exams.. predict my results too.."
Unadkat to Tiwary, $$FOUR$$ ,down the track, ends up slicing it high towards third man, who goes for the catch, tumbles forward, but it bounces in front, fine effort from Vinay
Unadkat to Tiwary,1 run,away to third man again, safely this time
Unadkat to Gambhir,2 runs,dabbed to the keeper's left, whose throw it way off target at the non-striker's, and they take another
Unadkat to Gambhir,1 run,back of a length, another guide to third man for a single, that is fifty for Gambhir
Unadkat to Tiwary,1 run,nudges a short one square to leg
Unadkat to Gambhir,no run,short and quick, he tries a pull and misses
Sharad Sharma: "Nas, you get another one out and I will make YOU the captain of my fantasy team :P"
Muralitharan to Tiwary, $$FOUR$$ ,he's got four for this, skips out, and chips it awkwardly over extra cover, beats long off running across
Muralitharan to Tiwary,no run,down the track again, finds midwicket now
Muralitharan to Tiwary,1 run,goes back, it is angled in, hit in front of square leg
Muralitharan to Gambhir,1 run,straightens from round the stumps, he runs it wide of short third man
Muralitharan to Tiwary,1 run,worked to midwicket for one more
Muralitharan to Gambhir,1 run,mistimes a pull to a length ball, to deep midwicket
Vipin Raghuwanshi: "Fantasy League teaches us that," We have to cling onto something that we think is good enough". We need to stick to a player we think is good enough to win us some points."
Unadkat to Gambhir,no run,short, wide and moving away, Gambhir misses the cut
Unadkat to Gambhir,1 run,this time he cannot beat Gayle at backward point, but goes through for one
Unadkat to Tiwary,2 runs,neat stop from Agarwal at fine leg, Tiwary top-edging a swat, bounces and is about to go over the boundary, Agarwal jumps and slaps it back in
Unadkat to Tiwary,no run
Unadkat to Tiwary,1 run,down the track, not much timing as he hits it down to long off
Unadkat to Gambhir, $$SIX$$ ,short and rising, he pulls it from outside off stump and just manages to clear the deep square leg rope
Gambhir having a discussion with umpire Rauf, about whether the short ball was too short
Vinay Kumar to Tiwary,1 run,steered to third man for a single
Vinay Kumar to Gambhir, $$OUT$$ ,Gambhir goes, clears front leg and slogs, edge flies high and bowler settled under it
Priya: "YP has been a disappointment for KKR for the price he was bought for, across seasons. Not enough bang for the buck."

Vinay Kumar to Tiwary,5 runs,overthrows, four of them, second time today, Tiwary helps a short ball on the bounce to short fine leg, from where RP goes for the striker;s end, misses, and there is no one to cut it off in time, Vinay makes it known that the throw should have been to his end, Tiwary would have struggled
Vinay Kumar to Morgan,no run,around the blockhole, patted back to the bowler
Vinay Kumar to Morgan,no run,and another one in the same spot, Morgan shuffles across but can only squeeze it back
Vinay Kumar to Morgan,1 leg bye,hit high on the pad as he tries to swing a length ball to square leg
Yuvaraja: "Moral of the story: Always have Gambhir and Vinay kumar in your team"
Singh to Morgan,2 runs,powers an overpitched delivery over extra cover, hasn;t timed it and long off gets around to it
Singh to Morgan, $$OUT$$ ,a disappointed Morgan has to go, he's slammed a low full toss from close to the toe end to the substitute Christian at long on
Timely blow for RCB
Singh to Tiwary,no run,tries to heave it from wide outside off to square leg and misses by a long way
Singh to Tiwary,1 run,now he's run it straight to point, very full outside off and he cannot beat the fielder
Singh to Bhatia,1 wide,straight down the leg side on a good length
Singh to Bhatia,1 run,pushes a high full toss to long on

Singh to Tiwary, $$OUT$$ ,higher full toss, swung straight to midwicket on the edge of the circle, they check for the no-ball for height, but he's just about okay, KKR losing their way, like the KKR of old used to

Vinay Kumar to Bhatia,2 runs,Bhatia's creamed this to the right of deep midwicket, who's taken it inside the rope, the momentum has carried him over. but he's got rid of the ball before, lobbing it towards deep square running across
Vinay Kumar to Bhatia, $$FOUR$$ ,nice, Bhatia bends the knee and paddles a full and slower one past short fine leg
Vinay Kumar to Bhatia, $$FOUR$$ ,Bhatia playing a little late gem, fine leg is back, but he's got a lot of bat on the pull off the bouncer, and beaten him quite easily
Vinay Kumar to Bhatia,1 run,low full toss, mishit down the ground, Bhatia slow to start running, single taken in the end
Vinay Kumar to McLaren,no run,Vinay angles it in full around the blockhole, McLaren has to push it back
Vinay Kumar to McLaren,2 runs,turns a length ball through square leg and makes it back for two
Singh to Bhatia,1 run,around the blockhole outside off, squeezed to point
Singh to McLaren, $$OUT$$ ,a very low full toss, almost a yorker, McLaren hits it close to the pitch to leg and goes for the single, RP has an easy run out, as he hits the stumps direct
Singh to Bhatia, $$OUT$$ ,another one gone, length ball on middle, Bhatia gets across, bends the knee and misses the paddle, RP strikes
Singh to Narine,1 run,full toss on the pads swung out to deep square leg
Singh to Sangwan,no run,he backs away to leg, RP follows him further down leg, he misses with the flick, but that hits the pad on its way to the keeper,
Singh to Sangwan, $$FOUR$$ ,a high full toss outside off, he swings hard, and a thick edge beats the keeper fine on the off side
KKR were 95 for 2 in the 13th over when Yusuf Pathan got out. And they kept losing wickets after that

Singh: "lets be fair to KKR here, 95/2 in 13 overs and ending at 154 is Okay to me. Someone from the top order had to fire to get a bigger score and noone did so, they have ended up at a reasonably decent score of 154.. I dont see the fuss here (comments like Pack of cards). KKR can win from here."
sammydude: "A pack of cards will fall much slower than the KKR batsmen!"
Shreesha Bhat: "Dinesh Karthik and Vinay Kumar... bet nobody, absolutely nobody expected them both to be holding the orange and purple caps at any stage of IPL"

name: Royal Challengers Bangalore v Kolkata Knight Riders

commentary.text: Gayle and Agarwal to open, McLaren with the new ball
McLaren to Gayle,no run,gets across and pushes a length ball angled across in front of cover, wants the single, has to get back quickly
McLaren to Gayle,no run,going across him with the angle again, slightly shorter, and he shoulders arms
McLaren to Gayle,no run,makes him play, he pushes a good length ball towards mid off
McLaren to Gayle, $$FOUR$$ ,short, Gayle swivels and pulls it hard, in the air over forward square leg
McLaren to Gayle,no run,skips down the pitch and looks to deposit the length ball over mid on, misses
McLaren to Gayle,no run,nice, making him play around off, and leaving him with the angle, very close to the outside edge, good bounce too
Kallis to bowl
Kallis to Agarwal, $$FOUR$$ ,full, wide, Agarwal reaches for it, and slices it over backward point
Kallis to Agarwal,1 run,stays on the crease and runs a length ball outside off to third man
Kallis to Gayle,1 run,length on the pads, calmly turned through square leg
Kallis to Agarwal,no run,pitched up on the stumps, he is across in the crease to block

Kallis to Agarwal,no run,loud appeal from Kallis for caught behind, Agarwal going for an awkward pull, replays show it hit the thigh pad before going low to the keeper, was there a bottom edge before that, not sure
Kallis to Agarwal,1 run,worked to deep square leg off the pad
McLaren to Agarwal,no run,shortish and wide, swinging away a tad, Agarwal goes after it and is beaten
McLaren to Agarwal,no run,wow, that is a ripper, banged in short of a length, and takes off and swerves away, Agarwal's bat far away from it as he wafts
McLaren to Agarwal,1 wide,now this one is angled in and moves down leg
McLaren to Agarwal, $$OUT$$ ,no problems with the edge this time, Agarwal trying to dab a shortish and wide one, healthy edge to the keeper
two slips
Ritesh: "Give Pathan a bowl - might work against gayle"
Chiro: "Teams get more scared these days when Gayle has a relaxed start..."
McLaren to Kohli,no run,checks the push to a straightening full ball outside off, to covers
McLaren to Kohli,1 run,short, Kohli adjusts to open the face and runs it to third man

McLaren to Gayle, $$SIX$$ ,Gayle has massacred this short ball for six over long on, it came quickly onto him, he didn;t look like he'd got much on the pull, all deception, it;s rocketed rows into the crowd
Kallis to Kohli,no run,pushes a pitched up ball wide of mid on
Kallis to Kohli,no run,across and behind the line to defend a back of a length ball
Kallis to Kohli,no run,he lost control of this swing, one hand coming off hand in the followthrough, beaten on the length ball outside off
Kallis to Kohli,no run,guides a short of a length ball to point
Kallis to Kohli,no run,full toss, but Kohli's turned this straight to midwicket, smiles sheepishly after that
Kallis to Kohli,no run,not hitting the gaps, Kohli, it's a maiden as he comes out and squeezes a full one to cover
Narine to Gayle
Narine to Gayle,no run,tossed up offbreak, pitches on leg, spins across, blocked off the front foot
Narine to Gayle,no run,flatter, bounces as it spins away, punched to cover
Narine to Gayle,1 run,tossed up fuller around off, he comes forward and runs it behind point
Narine to Kohli,no run,works an offspinner to midwicket
Narine to Kohli,1 run,shortish and quick, Kohli goes for the pull, mishits it in the air down the ground to long on
Narine to Gayle,no run,tries to sweep an offbreak but is beaten as it moves away outside off
Two tight overs and the rate is touching nine
McLaren to Kohli,1 wide,full and angled fast down the leg side, neat take by the keeper
McLaren to Kohli, $$FOUR$$ ,Kohli gets moving, takes a step out and heaves a short of a length ball past midwicket
McLaren to Kohli,no run,reaches out and pushes a pitched up ball to extra cover
McLaren to Kohli, $$FOUR$$ ,full, Kohli swipes, mid on is up, and he gets enough bat on it to lift it over the fielder
McLaren to Kohli,1 run,good length and straightening, he opens the face and runs it down to third man
McLaren to Gayle, $$SIX$$ ,whack! good length, Gayle sends it soaring over wide long on, gets front foot a few inches outside leg and picks it from around off

McLaren to Gayle, $$SIX$$ ,massive, six over cover, shifts further outside leg stump now, crouches and lifts an overpitched one over the infield, it lands comfortably over the rope, insane timing and power this man has
Ronak Agrawal: "One big over and rate is 8 ;)"
Narine to Kohli,no run,reaches out and hits a length ball to point
Narine to Kohli,no run,dabs an offbreak from off to short third
Narine to Kohli,1 run,straightening outside off, pushed wide of cover
Narine to Gayle,1 run,overpitched on the pads, worked to deep midwicket
Narine to Kohli, $$FOUR$$ ,offspinner bounces big on Kohli, but how well has he handled that, bends, delays the cut and hits the gap between short third man and backward point, lovely
Narine to Kohli,1 run,keeps strike with a single through the off side
VPS: "Gayle is Fantasy cricket's elite."
Nas: "The two tight overs just woke the two giants up. The rampage begins"
Balaji to Kohli,1 run,pitched up on the stumps, eased down to long on
Balaji to Gayle,no run,slowish length ball going across, Gayle shoulders arms
Balaji to Gayle,1 run,width, lots of it, Gayle reaches across and drills it past point's dive, good work from the sweeper to stop it
Balaji to Kohli,no run,beaten by a slower one angled in and bouncing, dies in front of the keeper
Balaji to Kohli,no run,holds its line on off, good length, Kohli runs it to point
Balaji to Kohli, $$FOUR$$ ,overpitched, and Kohli's sent it scorching along the ground to the deep extra cover rope, intent, full of intent
Dammodara: "How do you Describe Gayle's foot work? He don't move his feet at all.. But the pace he generates with his bat may be the fastest in the business..."
Saugat: "If any of these two survives, it would be easier than a cakewalk for RCB - we saw that against SRH the other day. In fact a walk through the cake will have more friction."
Sangwan comes on
Sangwan to Gayle, $$FOUR$$ ,gentle length ball outside off, and Gayle has scythed that past the man at mid off, who had only a few feet to cover to his right, he still couldn't get to it
Sangwan to Gayle,1 run,hit hard down to long on
Sangwan to Kohli, $$SIX$$ ,outstanding timing, shortish and sitting up, Kohli;s banished that several rows over deep midwicket with a swift pull
Sangwan to Kohli, $$SIX$$ ,over fine leg now, Kohli doing everything to show RCB don't entirely depend on Gayle, shortish again, and he swivels to pull, edge flies over the boundary
Sangwan to Kohli,(no ball) 1 run,high full toss, Kohli swats it to off for a single
Sangwan to Gayle,no run,short of a length, Gayle does not go after the width, guides it tamely to point
Sangwan to Gayle,no run,around the blockhole, Gayle pats it back
Balaji to Kohli, $$OUT$$ ,Balaji's slower one does it, Kohli comes out and slices it to sweeper cover running in

Kohli is cross about something, now he and Gambhir walk angrily towards each other, reminiscing their days together in Delhi, another Delhi man, Bhatia intervenes to avoid a possible collision and pats Kohli on the back to send him on his way
Balaji to de Villiers,no run,pitched up on the stumps, pushed to mid on
Balaji to de Villiers,no run,ending on off from a length, pushed to mid on again
Shashank Shekhar Mishra: "This is what i hate about Kohli, he is a good cricketer but his on field aggression is somewhat unnecessary and unacceptable."
Balaji to de Villiers,no run,Balaji getting in some quiet slower ones in, AB walks out, he shortens the length, and he has to drop it onto the pitch
Balaji to de Villiers,1 run
Balaji to Gayle, $$FOUR$$ ,third man is up, even if he was back, he would have struggled to stop this, Gayle has cut it so savagely backward of point
Sangwan to de Villiers,no run,tries to sweep one angling far away outside off, misses it
Sangwan to de Villiers,1 run,Balaji saves four with a sprawl to his right, AB connecting with the paddle this time
Sangwan to Gayle,1 run,very low full toss, Gayle squeezes it down to long on
yogi: "@Shashank To be fair to him he has been pretty relaxed this IPL but he is definitely not the only one to be blamed in the incident." True, it was Gambhir at the other end, not Rahul Dravid
Sangwan to de Villiers,1 run,flayed down to sweeper cover
Sangwan to Gayle, $$SIX$$ ,short ball, there is a man at deep midwicket, but Gayle's pulled it flat and well out of the reach of that fielder
Sangwan to Gayle,2 wides,he is ready with a foreboding backlift, but this one is too far outside off, keepre fails to gather
Sangwan to de Villiers, $$FOUR$$ ,AB's getting the width to murder them through extra cover, he's timed it too well this time, and the placement is wide enough of the sweeper
Balaji to Gayle,no run,slower and full, he tries to reach for it, misses
Balaji to Gayle,1 run,bat in front of pad to ease a pitched up ball to long off
Balaji to de Villiers,1 run, $$dropped$$ , touch chance, AB slapping a short ball high to the left of short extra cover, Tiwary goes leaping, but it goes down
Balaji to Gayle,no run,pushes an overpitched one to extra cover
Kapil: "Good.. Gambhir won't repeat the error of dropping Lee and playing McLaren again.. And why isn't Kallis bowling to Gayle.. he is master at bowling good short stuff pointing head/body"
Balaji to Gayle,1 wide,oops, he lost this one, very high full toss past the batsman, bounces close to the keeper
Balaji to Gayle, $$SIX$$ ,that has been carted into outer space, and has then been pulled down by gravity miles beyond deep midwicket, length around off, Gayle taking care of it
Balaji to Gayle,no run,nice recovery from Balaji, slowish and full around the blockhole, Gayle swings and gets an inside edge onto boot
Narine back, they need wickets
Narine to de Villiers, $$FOUR$$ ,outside edge, past slip, carrom ball moving away, AB had no clue about it
Narine to de Villiers,1 run,worked through midwicket from outside off
tushar: "That ball almost landed on my lap... I'm sitting in Delhi BTW"
Narine to Gayle,no run,pushes front foot forward, waits, and lets this offbreak pass by him outside off
Narine to Gayle,no run,tossed up, he comes forward and defends to point
Narine to Gayle,1 run,thick inside edge to the leg side as he gets forward to defend, and that is another fifty in the IPL for Chris Gayle, Chinnaswamy is generous is in the applause
Narine to de Villiers,no run,tries to reverse paddle, but misses, appeal for lbw turned down
Kallis to Gayle,1 run,overpitched from round the stumps, powered wide of the sweeper, who does well to get around to it
Kallis to de Villiers,1 run,walks outside off, and hits a very full one down the ground
abhijit pore: "Had Bhatia not intervened, they would have hit each other. Both of them should be disciplined and banned for a match."
Tshepiso: "Gayle, Kohli and De Villiers in the same team, what more else would you wish for???"
Kallis to Gayle,no run,slow and full and wide, Gayle reaches out and stabs it to point
Kallis to Gayle,no run,slow bouncer, Gayle cannot get bat to it as he tries the help it fine

John: "whenever Gayle is playing...dont go inside the stadium...stay outside the stadium and start collecting the balls which are coming ur way....if u do this for one year, you can start your own store to sell Semi-New balls."
Kunaal: "@ Tushar - Yup, it flew above my house before making a boomerang to your place in Delhi. I am in Singapore, BTW."
Kallis to Gayle,no run,in the blockhole outside off, even Gayle has to squeeze it to the bowler
Kallis to Gayle,1 wide,full, wide, way too wide outside off
Kallis to Gayle,2 runs,low full toss, point takes pace off the shot with a dive, Gayle charges back for the second and just makes it, better throw and he was gone

Sagar: "The problem with KKR is - they are persisting way too long with Kallis. Although, he is one of the greatest to have played the game, the KKR management needs to understand that they are doing a blunder by keeping guys like Tendo on bench. The 4 overseas players for KKR should be Morgan, Tendo, Narine and Brendon M."
Narine to de Villiers,no run,misses as he flashes at an offbreak outside off
Narine to de Villiers,no run,pushed to extra cover
Narine to de Villiers,no run
Narine to de Villiers,1 run,straight and quick, AB deep in the crease to push to long on
Narine to Gayle,1 run,sharp single, pushed off the front foot to cover and AB makes it comfortably
Narine to de Villiers,no run,beats him outside off with a straighter and quicker one that AB plays well inside the line of, he's had little clue about Narine this innings
Kallis to Gayle,no run,low full toss hit to extra cover
Kallis to Gayle,no run,nice work from Kallis, gets it around the blockhole first, and then gets the boot out to stop the hit from Gayle
Kallis to Gayle, $$SIX$$ ,fullish length this time, and Gayle punishes it, slamming it over long off
round the stumps
Kallis to Gayle,(no ball)  $$SIX$$ ,no difference to Gayle, uses the angle into him to shovel it over wide long on, making some room outside leg to swing big, it is also a no ball
Kallis to Gayle, $$FOUR$$ ,Gayle getting it done with, full toss outside off, and a slice takes it over backward point
Kallis to Gayle,no run,short, and he lets it go outside off
Kallis to Gayle,1 run,heaves at a full toss, thick edge runs down to third man
Bhatia in the firing line
Saugat: "I think the Orange Cap should be awarded to Gayle even before the IPL begins, . What difference does it make? He's gonna take it anyway!"
Paresh: "@Sagar: You just read my mind. I think at some stage management (not just KKR, but others as well, if you know what I mean) have to take tough calls in favor of the team/competition..."
Bhatia to Gayle,1 run,slow and full, quietly pushed to covers for one
Bhatia to de Villiers,no run,walks outside off, Bhatia takes it away from the right hander slowly, AB beaten on the cut
Bhatia to de Villiers, $$SIX$$ ,slow length ball sitting up, AB makes room and swats it over the straight boundary
Bhatia to de Villiers,1 run,drills an overpitched one to wide long off
Bhatia to Gayle,1 wide,good length ball straight and down the leg side
Bhatia to Gayle,1 run,very full, Gayle makes some room, and eases it through the off side
Bhatia to de Villiers,no run,pitched up and disdainfully driven through the off side, but extra cover in the way
Ankit Bhutoria: "Why take a strategic time out now, as no amount of strategy can bring KKR back into this game?"
Balaji to Gayle,no run,slow length ball, tries to steer it to third man, misses
Balaji to Gayle, $$SIX$$ ,short, Gayle swivels and pulls, again it appears he hasn;t timed it, but try telling the man at deep square leg that, he had no chance as it sailed over
Balaji to Gayle,1 wide,slanted too wide across the left-hander
Balaji to Gayle, $$SIX$$ ,that will be that, he banishes a length ball high over long on to end with nine sixes
$$The$$ $$Huddle$$  - have you been to one yet? - is set to begin.  $$Join$$ $$in$$
That does it for another Gayle storm. Hop over to  $$Pune$$ $$v$$ $$Rajasthan$$  now.
Gayle is Man of the Match, well of course. Gayle: "You can put the boundary wherever you want, I'll take on the challenge. I'm hungry, I need some food [what his Twitter feed will say tonight]."
