$$Kohli$$ : "Its done, what is done on the field is done [his spat with Gambhir]. Great game for us. When you know Gayle is leaving the ball, the opposition has to be more worried than when he is hitting it."

$$Gambhir$$ : "It happens in the heat of the moment. We dont need to carry it off the field. It is a tough sport, no love lost. All credit to Chris, he took the game away from us. We were in the same position last year as well. Hopefully we can turn it around. You have to get 160-170 here when you bat first. It is not like Kolkata or other venues where 140 is fine."
Another team Gayled today. Nuff said.
Kohli gets the orange cap for being the leading run-getter this season for now

stogy: "Yes, Ankit. I can imagine Gayle also using the strategic time out to maximum effect, telling AB, "Yes, I am planning to continue hitting the ball really hard" and AB answering "ermm yes erm erm... good idea. Great strategy""
Jayesh: "RCB should change their team name to GCB = Gayle Challengers Bangalore! :)"
Kumar Saurabh: "Well..its a dangerous bell ringing for other teams. He just hits it so effortlessly...god."
Somesh: "Believe me , teams are making 15-20 less runs -- just to prevent a century from Gayle. Call it strategy!"
$$8.00pm$$  Danny Morrison is back to calling Rajasthan Royals as the double-Rs. The countdown is on as we're set to go.

$$7.50pm$$  Plenty of Luke Wright fans on today. Here's Praharsha: "Luke Wright's T20 strike rate is 138 when compared to Finch's 136 and Luke is more than handy with the ball. PWI have surely missed a firepower trick!"

Debi Prasad: "I want to see RR doing well this year (may be win the title), even though I am a SRH fan. The reason is one man, Dravid. He is most probably playing his last IPL and I want to see him go away with a hurrah, unlike Dada."

Aqil: "Pune paid loads for the likes of Mendis and Richardson... no where to be seen!" Kane Richardson had to be one of the strangest picks at the auction. That much money for an unproven specialist quick?
Is there a single person happy with the teams picked today? Ashish: "Where is RR hiding Owais Shah. I feel he should be picked in the side over the so called Sanath Jayasurya Avatar (Perera)."
Sanju Z: "Spare a thought for Steve Smith. He was Pune's best player last season, was the second best player for Australia in India (other than Clarke) and still can't get a game.."

$$7.40pm$$  Cobra Jain: "Seriously no steven smith again? Mathews should give him a chance" And also, Luke Wright, who has had a terrific time with England in T20s over the past year. But Finch comes in as Pune desperately look for some firepower at the top of the order, with Robin Uthappa struggling for form and Manish Pandey picking up another duck.
Anirudh: "if pune fail again, with the likes of yuvi, ross, mathews , they must really make some big decisions( mathew- captain?)".

"I think it's a travesty that Pune keep ignoring Tamim Iqbal. He's just the type who can give them a blazing start. Send Uthappa down the order!" Mohammed Surti and other angry Tamim fans, he's not in India for the IPL as Bangladesh have a Zimbabwe tour starting within a week.
James: "Big team news from Rajasthan: Watson, Tait out due to injuries. Also big team news from Rome. Pope still Catholic." Ha ha!
Kalyan: "Finch should make the team irrespective how others are playing in the team. He provides the flying start which will help the likes of Yuvi and Taylor to cash on later!"

Figgy: "How on earth is Luke Wright not getting in this Warriors side especially considering their performance so far? Some of the selections from the teams are costing them games so far this year, I think this could be another one and this is set to be another one."

$$Toss$$  Rahul Dravid calls 'Tails,' and Dravid wins the toss.  $$Rajasthan$$ $$will$$ $$bat$$ . Dravid says the track looks good, and that it might get slower later in the evening. Mathews says he wasn't sure what he would have done if he won the toss, though he thinks the surface may be a bit two-paced.
Big team news from  Rajasthan:  $$Watson,$$ $$Tait$$ $$and$$ $$Rahul$$ $$Shukla$$ $$out$$  due to injuries. Faulkner, Harmeet and Kushal Perera in (are you happy Farook?) .
For Pune, Marlon Samuels and Manish Pandey are out. Aaron Finch and Yuvraj Singh take their place.
Have you seen our new  $$Match$$ $$Companion$$ , where cricket meets social media.
And our daily Google Hangout  $$The$$ $$Huddle$$  is live now. Isa Guha and Aakash Chopra are the guests today as the gang takes an offbeat look at events in the IPL.

$$7.20pm$$  Well, Chris Gayle has again done what Chris Gayle does best, dispatching bowlers to all parts of the Chinnaswamy Stadium. Nine sixes in his innings as Kolkata Knight Riders, like so many teams before them, had no way of stopping Gayle.
Now, the focus shifts to Pune, where the Warriors take on Rajasthan Royals.
Mayank: "hoping for a yuvi-uthappa show today. this batting line up is too good to miss-out again."
Farook: "really looking forward for Kushal Perera to get another chance... Please RR one more chance... sob.."
$$7.00pm$$  Pune are desperately in need of a turnaround. Can Yuvraj Singh's return do the trick for them? Here's our  $$preview$$  to the game.

Given the sort of recent T20 form he's had, Yuvraj is perhaps a shoo-in for your  $$Fantasy$$ $$XI$$ . Or do you fancy Kevon Cooper? Huge relief for the Pune Warriors. They had begun so well last season, winning three out of four, and then barely won a game for the rest of the season. They started this year with a couple of defeats, prompting a re-jig at the top of the order. It paid off, and how. Uthappa and Finch killed off this chase in the Powerplay.

$$Robin$$ $$Uthappa:$$  "We really needed this. We have worked hard as a team. Donald has helped everybody keep calm, deal with the pressure. I think we have got a hang of this wicket now, it is a young wicket, it is still settling in, it will take time to become a flat Twenty20 wicket. I was pleased to get the team off to a good start, we have been a bit apprehensive with our approach, probably because of the losses before."
Here's the latest  $$points$$ $$table$$ .

Man of the Match is  $$Aaron$$ $$Finch$$ : "It was nice, we knew we had to get off to a good start, the wicket gets a bit slower and lower as the ball gets older. Credit goes to Uthappa, 32 off 16 really set us up. Today was our day, it was nice to get away with it. I thought our bowlers did a great job to restrict them after that partnership between Rahul and Rahane."

KM: "Ponting has looked out of sorts, really, in this IPL, not once has he even touched a strike rate of 100. Furthermore, he's been putting pressure on SRT. Even looking at the match against RCB, Pointing played out 32 balls for 28 runs, whereas SRT has 27 (21). Clearly, Ponting is not doing much to earn his place as a batsman - more so as an international player. All that said, if his captaincy is worth all that he's occupying - this really being a decision for the MIs think-tank to make - he should be made to open, given the chances of his scoring runs are maximum with fielding restriction."

Rohit Sharma is the Man of the Match. Rohit: "It is important for the team for me to get going. I wanted to get runs behind my back and I am happy I did it today. Karthik was hitting the ball well, better than me, my role was to give him as many balls as possible. I wanted to wait for the right time, probably after the 15th and 16th over, and I got it right."

Ricky Ponting being cheered at Wankhede. Ponting: "180 was always going to be tough for the opposition to chase. We got off to a better start. We laid the foundation for the boys to come in and smack it around. Dinesh and Rohit and playing incredibly well. We are getting to know each others' games particularly well. We were outstanding with the new ball today."

Angelo Mathews: "We were pretty poor on the field. Last five overs we could not execute our plans. We had to nail those yorkers and could not do it. Dinda, Bhuvi, Marsh have been doing it for past few games, I back my bowlers."
